avalancheActivity.comment: Human triggered slab avalanche fell in Hrafnbjörg by Skriða, 10-12/4. Natural avalanches in SW aspects around Skjaldbreiður have fallen in the last weeks.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is considered rather stable but chances of wet avalanches increases in rainy weather this weekend. Cornice collapse is possible and small slab avalanches also. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Old wind slabs are possible on firn high in mountains, especially inland, but the snow cover is mostly considered stable. A snow pit was taken in Bláfjöll (17th of April) that gave CTM#15 at 112 cm and ECTX. Cornice collapse is possible and potentially could initiate small slab avalanches where wind slabs persist. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls is high where snow is frozen high in the mountains. Chances of wet avalanche activity increases on Friday/Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely weak layer by firn. Intense thaw this weekend and chances if wet avalanche activity widely, with potentially larege avalaenches where thick windslabs persist. Even sluss floods could be expected where most rain falls.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely a weak layer by firn. Thaw this weekend and chances of wet avalanche activity widely, even sluss floods where rain is heaviest.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi rigning í sunnan áttum með laugardeginum en ákefð eykst um kvöldið. Styttir upp og lægir á sunnudag og hæglætis veður eftir helgi.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches occurred in Kirkjubólshlíð early last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Intense thaw is forecasted on Saturday, which could cause large wet avalanches. Thick layered wind slabs are in the area, on top of older firn. A weak layer has been found between wind slabs.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thick layered wind slabs are on top of older firn, and a weak layer has been found in the snowpack. Rising temperatures on Saturday with strong S-wind and rain. The thaw could cause wet avalanches, possibly large ones, or slush avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely weak layer by firn. Intense thaw this weekend and chances if wet avalanche activity widely, with potentially larege avalaenches where thick windslabs persist. Even sluss floods could be expected where most rain falls.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely a weak layer by firn. Thaw this weekend and chances of wet avalanche activity widely, even sluss floods where rain is heaviest.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-átt með snjókomu á föstudagskvöld. Snýst í S-átt og hlýnar í veðri aðfaranótt laugardags. Á laugardag bætir í rigningu og verður mesta ákefðin á laugardagskvöld. Á sunnudag snýst í SV-átt með kólnandi veðri og dálítilli snjókomu. Á mánudag er útlit fyrir þurrt og milt veður.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several slabs in E-NE winds a week ago and a big slab avalanche in the NW-winds on Monday in Fljót. Many slab avalanches in repeated northerly snowstorms since the weekend before Easter. Several human triggered slabs were released and many big natural occured during the snowstorms
avalancheActivity.highlights: Persistent weak layer is still present and risk for big avalanches increases due to warming on Saturday. Layered windslabs in most aspects but mainly after prevailing NE winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Prevailing NE winds and heavy snow accumulation have built up layered windslabs after easter and also a week ago in E-NE winds and NW-winds on Monday. Snow pits form the region show a PWL at the interfaces between windslabs and firn and inbetween windslabs as well. A snowpit from Ólafsfjörður 16th of april showed a PWL below a MF crust at the surface of the old firn which failed with medium load and gave sudden planar fracture. This weakness may be at significant depths due to heavy snow accumulation lately and intense warming on Saturday could trigger large avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely weak layer by firn. Intense thaw this weekend and chances if wet avalanche activity widely, with potentially larege avalaenches where thick windslabs persist. Even sluss floods could be expected where most rain falls.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely a weak layer by firn. Thaw this weekend and chances of wet avalanche activity widely, even sluss floods where rain is heaviest.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áköf hlýindi einkenna laugardag ásamt lítilsháttar rigningu í S áttum, hvessir með kvöldinu. SV úrkomuskot gengur yfir aðfaranótt sunnudags með snjókomu til fjalla. Styttir upp og lægir eftir helgi með frosti til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several loose avalanches seen by Neskaupstaður on Tuesday and Wednesday. Few small avalanches have been seen around the area after last weeks snowfall and warming.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Thaw is forecasted over the weekend which increases chances of wet avalanches. Considerable snow is at high elevations and inland after NE-snow in recent weeks. Weak layers are expected to be present between wind slabs. New snow is widely in the area and cornices at high elevations.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow has accumulated at high elevations after snowfall in NE-winds in recent weeks. The snow is layered, with windslabs of different hardness where a weakness could persist. A weakness deep in the snowpack could still be found at high elevations. A layer of new snow accumulated early this week and cornices are widely on S-W aspects. A thaw is expected during the weekend with increased chances of wet avalanche activity.

travelAdvisory.comment: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely weak layer by firn. Intense thaw this weekend and chances if wet avalanche activity widely, with potentially larege avalaenches where thick windslabs persist. Even sluss floods could be expected where most rain falls.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Layered windslab in N part of Iceland and widely a weak layer by firn. Thaw this weekend and chances of wet avalanche activity widely, even sluss floods where rain is heaviest.

weatherForecast.highlights: Dálítil snjókoma á föstudagskvöld í S-átt. Hlýnar skarpt á laugardag og hlánar upp fyrir fjallstoppa. Líkur á skúrum. Snýst í V-átt á sunnudag og kólnar um tíma. Á mánudag er útlit fyrir þurrt og milt veður.
